comment: Prof Green knew his stuff, but couldn't dumb it down to us that didnt have much experience in acct. He gave 10 question quizzes after each chapter covered. Homework in connect. Reviewed quizzes, homework and tests after each was due or completed in class. Very helpful, but has a hard time clarifying and making the information understandable.

Green was a great teacher for my first acct class. He takes it slow to make sure that students really understand the material. Really nice! He does give quizzes every week but they help you know where you stand and what you need to study. Power points are online. The book really helped me as well. I went to class and study and i got an A.

DO Not, I REPEAT DO NOT take him. He was hard to understand. All he does id read from the power point, and he gives quiz every other day, so you have to go to class. Take someone else, you will thank me later.
Easy to understand. He is very organized and will stay on topic. Available online if needed with questions about homework. Plenty of opportunities to increase grades

Extremely hard to comprehend. Power points teach you nothing and does not work problems on board, which from last semester helped me more than anything. Doesn't make sense a lot of the time and tends to make things very confusing because he doesn't review what we are learning before class so he confuses the class. I won't take him again
Good straightforward teacher.  Do the homework and get the book and you will be fine.  If you can study accounting tests previously taken that will give you an advantage.  An easily attained B

2 WORDS: straight forward. As long as you read the book regularly, you have every reason to expect an A. Quizzes and online homework weekly, but it helps keep you on track since the material is tedious. Not the most exciting guy but he's got experience.

I was not happy about taking accounting and had previously withdrawn from an online class because it was too difficult. Green made accounting easy and understandable. Its not easy, its accounting, but its as easy as it gets.

Green is EXCELLENT. I took him for 2100 as well. He gives you SO MANY opportunities to do well in his class. I have absolutely nothing but WONDERFUL things to say about him AND his class. I didn't even use the book once. DON'T BUY IT for his class! EVERYTHING on powerpoints. I saved them all for future reference. He really is the best. I got an A.
Very nice Man! But he speaks low and soft and teaches with powerpoints.  If you can learn and pay attention to a soft spoken person TAKE HIM.

3 test, 12 quizzes, a decent amount of homework, and a couple extra credit opportunities.  He posts his powerpoints online, but you can mostly learn everything from the book anyway.   Do the homework to understand each chapter, do well on the tests overall, and take advantage of the EC and you will pull out with an A.

Nice guy. Used powerpoints for every class. There is a quiz after every chapter. Homework is online for every chapter. Attendance does court towards your grade. He explains the material very clearly. If you don't mind going to class, I'd take him!

Sometimes lectures were confusing but he was always willing to take time and explain/answer questions. Posts all powerpoints online. Lots of points available through easy quizzes and HW and gives some extra credit opportunities. Made a B with very minimal studying, prob could have made an A with a little more effort.

I had to drop ACCT 2100 the first time I tryed to take it, because none of the concepts made sence. However, when I took Green it all made sence. He has a way of explaining things so that anyone can understand. I was really close to getting an "A" I recommend him to everyone I know.

Pr. Green is very good. He teaches from powerpoints, but he actually explains the concepts and make sure you understand. He gives a good amount of extra credit, and the tests are pretty straightforward. Highly recommended. Attendance is mandatory (some percentage of the grade)
